items.content:
This toolbox is a real treasure chest!

In the toolbox you will find:

  • Grammar
  • Vocabulary (words and sentences)
  • Pronunciation
  • Fun
  • Reference

First you are going to study a couple of grammar items.
Make sure you understand all the items.

After that you are going to practise some vocabulary, words and sentences.
They are all very important parts of a language!

Good luck!

Grammar
If you want to be able to do all the assignments correctly you will need to know more about some grammar items.

You are going to learn about:

  • Personal pronouns
  • To be
  • Present simple

For each item you have to take a good look at the StudioEngels grammar blocks and then you are going to do some exercises.

First we have a look at:

  • Personal Pronouns
  • Words
  • Pronunciation

Good luck!

Personal Pronouns
Study the section on personal pronouns. Grammar: Personal Pronouns
Look at the movie.

prompt.body:
Welk persoonlijk voornaamwoord moet op de open plaats?
 (Jullie) ...... are not in my class.

Welk persoonlijk voornaamwoord moet op de open plaats?
 (Zij) ...... are all in the same class.

Welk persoonlijk voornaamwoord moet op de open plaats?
Are (jij) ...... in class 1A?

Welk persoonlijk voornaamwoord moet op de open plaats?
 (Wij) ...... are new at school.

Welk persoonlijk voornaamwoord moet op de open plaats?
 (Ik) ...... am new at school.

Welk persoonlijk voornaamwoord moet op de open plaats?
 There is Tom. (Hij) ...... is new at school.

Welk persoonlijk voornaamwoord moet op de open plaats?
 Is ....... (zij) in class 1B?

Welk persoonlijk voornaamwoord moet op de open plaats?
 (Zij) ...... are pupils at this school.

Welk persoonlijk voornaamwoord moet op de open plaats?
 Can you hear ...... (haar).

Welk persoonlijk voornaamwoord moet op de open plaats?
 This message is for ...... (hem).

Welk persoonlijk voornaamwoord moet op de open plaats?
 It is an invitation for ..........(mij).

Welk persoonlijk voornaamwoord moet op de open plaats?
 I can hear ...........(jullie).

Welk persoonlijk voornaamwoord moet op de open plaats?
 She can not find ..........(het).

Welk persoonlijk voornaamwoord moet op de open plaats?
 Please, listen to ..........(ons).

Welk persoonlijk voornaamwoord moet op de open plaats?
 You must send .............(hen) a postcard.

Welk persoonlijk voornaamwoord moet op de open plaats?
 I can help .......(jou).

content.body:
Vul het juiste persoonlijk voornaamwoord in.

  • (Ik) work three days a week.
  • (Zij) lives in Essex.
  • (Jij) leave at 9.30 pm.
  • (Wij) are waiting for you.
  • (Hij) works three days a week.
  • (Jullie) live in Essex.
  • (Zij) leave at 9.30 pm.

Vul het juiste persoonlijk voornaamwoord in.

  • (Het) will be great if she comes.
  • John is late, because (hij) overslept.
  • The children are so happy, (zij) are singing.
  • Are (jij) leaving today?.
  • I'm sure (wij) have met before.
  • Please, listen to (mij).
  • I can hear (u).

Vul het juiste persoonlijk voornaamwoord in.

  • It's a invitation for (haar).
  • You must send (hem) a postcard.
  • Can you hear (ons).
  • She can't find (het).
  • This message is for (hen).
  • We can help (jullie).
  • Can you forgive (ons).
  • We gave (jullie) lots of cakes.
  • Give it to (hen).
  • I give (jou) a present.

Fill in the right personal pronoun.

  • is dreaming. (George).

Fill in the right personal pronoun.

  • is green. (The blackboard).

Fill in the right personal pronoun.

  • are on the wall. (The posters).

Fill in the right personal pronoun.

  • is running. (The dog).

Fill in the right personal pronoun.

  • are watching TV. (My mother and I).

Fill in the right personal pronoun.

  • are in the garden. (The flowers).

Fill in the right personal pronoun.

  • is riding his bike. (Tom).

Fill in the right personal pronoun.

  • is from Bristol. (Victoria).

Fill in the right personal pronoun.

  • has got a brother. (Diana).

Fill in the right personal pronoun.

  • Have got a computer, Mandy?

Fill in the right personal pronoun.

  • The teacher always gives homework. (The students).

Fill in the right personal pronoun.

  • I am reading the book to . (My little sister).

Fill in the right personal pronoun.

  • The boys are riding . (Their bikes).

Fill in the right personal pronoun.

  • My father is writing a letter to . (John).

Fill in the right personal pronoun.

  • I don't know . (The answer).

Fill in the right personal pronoun.

  • Sally is going to . (Anne).

Fill in the right personal pronoun.

  • Open please. (The window).

Fill in the right personal pronoun.

  • Can you tell the way to the airport please? (The people).

Fill in the right personal pronoun.

  • The books are for . (Peter).

Fill in the right personal pronoun.

  • Can you help , please? (Me and my sister).

prompt.body:
Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.

My mother always gives ... a cookie after dinner. (My brother)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.

... is reading a book. (My dad)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.

Your niece always reads to ... . (Her brother and sister)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.

The dog lost ... . (The tennis ball)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.

... are cycling to school. (James, Ester and Renee)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.

... are reading a book in class. (My classmates and I)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.

I am writing a letter to ... . (Jack)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.

... is drawing a cow. (Mandy)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.

These sweets are for ... . (You and me)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.

The video is for ... . (The children)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.

... is from Germany. (My aunt)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.

The toy truck is for ... . (Her little brother)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.

... is not far from London. (Manchester)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.

... often come and see us. (Theo and Leah)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.

Would ... like this, Joy?

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.

... like Disney films. (My children)

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.

My name is Robert Fleck. ... am a firefighter.

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.

His friends are so strong. ... are athletes.

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.

Lucie isn't from Russia. ... is from Brazil.

Choose the right personal pronoun for the sentences below.

My doctor is from Germany. ... is a very good doctor.

items.content:
English becomes easier once you know more words and sentences. For each theme there are words and sentences related to it on www.wrts.nl .

The first time you use WRTS, you need to register.

  • Go to www.wrts.nl .

  • Click on 'Meld je nu meteen aan!'
  • Insert your email address.
  • Insert a password.
  • Insert your password again ('Bevestiging').
  • Click on 'aanmelden'.
Don't forget your password!

Start using WRTS:

  • Go to http://wrts.nl/studiovoengels and log in.
  • Decide which list you want to practise.
    There are five lists for the theme:
    • Personal A
    • Personal B
    • Personal C
    • Personal chuncks A
    • Personal chuncks B
  • Click on 'overnemen' behind the list you want to use. You will see the list. Scroll down and click on 'opslaan'.
  • Click on 'overhoren'. Indicate how you want to practise the words and click on 'begin overhoring'. It is a good idea to practise the words in different ways.

Good luck!

On languageguide.org you will find the pronunciation (uitspraak) of important words in this theme!

You are going to learn how to say the alphabet so you can introduce yourself in another language when necessary.
You are also going to learn about school vocabulary so you can ask your teacher the right questions in English.

Go to:

  • Alphabet-1
  • Alphabet-2
  • School

The last 5 minutes of every lesson ...........

  • Have you filled in your workplan yet?
  • Write down in your notebook what went right and what was difficult.
  • Did you learn new words? If so, are they already in your notebook, to learn at home.
  • Continue with Duolingo.

• Learn Toolbox (Grammar) personal pronouns
  • Learn words and chunks Personal A and Personal chunks A
